website_summaries.verdict: If stability and quality is your first concern, this steel stand is a reliable choice at a decent price.
pros: Will work on trees up to about 20" dia
Climber model, easy to put up
Multiple positions on the footrest and shooting rail allow you to adjust for your height and comfort
cons: This stand is heavier than others at about 29 lb

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but strong . I reccomend it.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Easy to get it in a tree. I'm in it right now and I feel safe. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: brett bergerom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, extremely comfortable. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday. Super easy assembly. This is my first ever tree stand so I have nothin to compre it to, but i think this thig is fantastic! Stupidly easy to assemble, extremely sturdy, and very comfortable. Ive only gone as high as 15’ but once i find the right tree ill go up higher. People complain about the harness but its really not that bad for coming with it. This is definitely a heavier stand but i apprecite that while up in the tree. Overall definitely reccomend for $140
customer_reviews.author: Dres2703

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for price
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this earlier this months and got two deer already with it. It is a great tree stand for climbing. It is a bit heavy and the back straps are poor and it can be a bit clanky. So I wouldn’t recommend this for a long hike and set up or if you are planning on hunting in that area right away but is a good stand to set up in the morning or night before and go out. I was hesitant about the mesh seat when I bout it but it feels great was able to sit for 6 hours without problems. Lastly for the price you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: phillycnsmer

customer_reviews.title: Cool stand. Harness made in China...
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Easy set up and take down. Performs like a boss and the last one I had lasted over 20 years before needing replacement. The grey and black color scheme looks sexy. CONS: The foam padding that covers the foot/gun rest tears easy, be careful. The padding covers are black, not camo. It sucks to carry on your back, kinda like every other stand. The harness is made in China, NOT the USA. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Safety is the most important thing while in the stand
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this climber last hunting season to do some bow hunting out of and I think this product is wonderful. my main concern when I purchased item was do they have all necessary safety features. After receiving climber and using it for over a year now I've noticed that everything works as should. its light compared to other named brand climbing stand. its compact and can set up within minutes. It is very relieving whenever I'm in the stand and I have safety straps on climber to know that when I'm that high up that wont be dropping from stand.
customer_reviews.author: JoeJoo

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy to haul.
customer_reviews.text: I never took it out of the box because I nearly broke my back lifting the package. Much heavier than advertised. I wouldn't even consider carrying this for any sort of distance. I spent a few more bucks and got one that wouldn't break my back or the bank. Cost is not everything.
customer_reviews.author: Buy American Made

customer_reviews.title: The most value packed climber stand on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, quiet, simple and efficient design. I use the stand for bow and gun hunting. For bow hunting I leave the foot rest down, and flip it up for gun season to use as a gun rest. Another nice feature is the netting seat quietly pushes back and out of the way for making shots behind you while standing. I don't really care for the foot rest padding. I have since removed it after installing it. The padding can make a small amount of noise and I don't really see much use for it.
customer_reviews.author: fitz

customer_reviews.title: I really cannot imagine a better climbing stand
customer_reviews.text: I really cannot imagine a better climbing stand. I find the stand to be quite easy to use it offers great improvement over my older one from 2004. They made some great changes in this model in the last few months that address the only issue I had with the old one. They have introduced square rails to accept the cables. The cables now have square heads that only go in one way. Much safer and easier to assure you have it done correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: Used it all elk season it is a little heavy but a better backpack style strap system would help maybe even add a waist belt with some back padding that is removable. Had no problems climbing or sitting in it for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Tree Stand
customer_reviews.text: It's well put together and very stable when I'm in it. The width of the chair is based on the diameter of the tree you choose so it can be a bit tight if you pick a small dia. tree. It is made of steel so it's not a stand I would want to carry for any long distance but it's been great and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kulp

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, cheap, nice stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is sturdy and a great price. I just purchased this year and took it out a handful of times now and love it. It’s a heavy stand so you won’t have a good time if you plan to lug this thing a mile into the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: On time and well packaged.
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and packaged well. Happy with the climber. Instructions could be illustrated better.
customer_reviews.author: War eagle

customer_reviews.title: Received stand and after looking at it seems very good and usable
customer_reviews.text: Received stand and after looking at it seems very good and usable. Quite simple to operate however this is quite heavy to take on all day hunts in back country along with other gear.
customer_reviews.author: cowboy

customer_reviews.title: The box lies !
customer_reviews.text: Nice stand , no way it weighs the 25 lbs on box , it's heavy! And don't expect the ol'man logo on black pad even though it's list right on box with logo , comes with 2 different pads both blank no logo , in all don't ho by box it's very miss leading
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic clips are terrible
customer_reviews.text: The stand itself is very comfortable but the biggest flaw with this item was that when I received it the plastic clip that connects the top to the bottom was broken and the first time i took it out the clip that holds the straps to the frame to carry the stand with broke.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Causey

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stick with ladders and stands/fixed. Difficcult to climb through the stand over. mesh. Dangerous
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Hildebrand

customer_reviews.title: This stand is simple and easy to attach
customer_reviews.text: The stand is a little heavy but works just as described. Some of the fancier stands have too many bells and whistles. This stand is simple and easy to attach. The only cons are the weight and it takes some getting used to packing it up as it does not quite pack together like the older old man's did. Cant beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jlp2009

customer_reviews.title: as good as ever
customer_reviews.text: been using these stands for about 22 years. still working as good as ever.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa M Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Comfortable to sit in for long periods. I wasn't sure about the seat but I like it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Climbed great and sits good.  But has poor quality paint.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for me and my son. The stand climbs great and is very comfortable. My only complaint is rust. Both were rusty and scratched up. That really bummed me out at first but after climbing a tree I decided to just wire brush/sand the rusty spots and spray paint them. I guess most companies cut corners somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: dbullx

customer_reviews.title: Love Ol Man stands
customer_reviews.text: My husband has always hunted out of Ol Man stands. He loves them and trusts them. "Year after year and deer after deer, you just can't beat Ol Man stands" my husband.
customer_reviews.author: mistyb919

customer_reviews.title: Son Likes It!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 26-year-old son's birthday and he said it worked great but the harness is a little "lame." Hence, four stars instead of five.
customer_reviews.author: Martha N.

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad climber at all, just a little heavier than advertised, but sturdy in the tree
customer_reviews.author: Seth Lange

customer_reviews.title: Great stand overall
customer_reviews.text: stand is very comfortable and easily folds up into a back packable package, the only complaint i hhave is it is a little heavier than i like to carry long distances. i wish i would have went with the aluminum version of this product. but for the money and with a harness included in the price it is a very good deal. i would recomend this to a fried
customer_reviews.author: buff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome climber. I only wish I would have gotten ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome climber. I only wish I would have gotten it sooner. Got it at the end of deer season and it helped me bag 2 deer in one hunt because I was able to carry it to the back end of my property and set up quietly, close to a bedding area.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M Mosley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand. Easy to understand instructions and easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stand. Easy to understand instructions and easy to get up in the tree. Seat is very comfortable and feel safe and stable in it.
customer_reviews.author: cam

customer_reviews.title: Works well and travels well
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed having this stand, it is simple and attaches to a tree quickly and easily in the dark. I hunt public lands were I am not allowed to leave a stand in the woods so have to set it up every time I hunt. The large pins and nuts on this stand make set up and removal in low light situations easy. It is comfortable for several hours of hunting at a time. I found I needed to "Dummy cord"--tie off--the pins that connect the cables to the stand as with my fat fingers I didn't want to drop a black pin in the woods in the dark and try to find it.
customer_reviews.author: skypilot39b

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The teeth doesn't grip trees very well, and makes the stand incredibly dangerous. I know using a climbing tree stand has risks, but this was just ridiculous. The teeth came loose from the tree and caused the bottom to fall, when this happened, the straps holding the top and bottom snapped, leaving me no way to get back to ground level. Just stuck.. 20ft in the air. Talk about a scary situation! Back to the ol trusty stand I went! Wouldn't buy again or recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Holds me up just fine
customer_reviews.text: This is my first climber. I am 225lbs, and it holds me up with easy and is very steady.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Blair

customer_reviews.title: Overall great stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand came with good directions. It was fully accessible with all of the parts and harness. It isn't as heavy as all the other reviews make it out to be. It had great shipping speed.
customer_reviews.author: Ericca

customer_reviews.title: Great stand and easy to learn how to use
customer_reviews.text: I have not used for hunting yet, but I did take it out and climb a few trees in the areas I hunt. It was easy to learn how to climb with this stand and I felt secure the entire time. The only part I found a little tricky was determining how far to angle the stand up before climbing so that I would be level up in the tree. I will learn that with more experience. I am looking forward to hunting from this stand during deer season.
customer_reviews.author: JandE

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Watched a youtube vid and was climbing trees with ease and I have a fear of heights. with the bars it felt like a little cage and made me feel secure.
customer_reviews.author: jed mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great equipment! I bought this for my husband and he loves it! It's so comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Riggins

customer_reviews.title: Best stand for the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product it arrived in 3 days. Great quality folds together flat for excellent portability, a good quality powder coat finish very nice stand hardly even notice the additional weight.
customer_reviews.author: David 1028

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy but very sturdy in the tree hard to carry too. Already thwacked one out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, Good quality!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very good treestand. This is the 3rd one I have owned. They are a little heavier than I like, but they are easy to attach to the tree and comfortable. I really like Ol'Man products!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorJunky

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for being so minimal
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, very light for steel construction, very easy to hook up and use, a very fast climber. I can be on and up the tree in less than 15 minutes. I spent over TEN hours in it with no problem!,!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry a whirt jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best price and the best stand to bow hunt out of
customer_reviews.author: Joshua McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tree Stand
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Tree Stand. Extremely comfortable. Not the lightest thing, but for the money you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my favorite climber. replaced my older one with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great climber
customer_reviews.text: Love this climber! This is my second Ol'Man stand, the first was stole out of the back of my truck. I have also had a Summit and I would choose Ol'Man over it any day. This is very comfortable and very quite. The only thing I wish was different was the bottom part that you stand on was a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: JDillard

customer_reviews.title: Michael from Mobile, AL
customer_reviews.text: Great climber, I would recommend this climber to anyone. Shipping was fast and very easy to set up, the mess seat is perfect for bow hunters, makes zero noise, and footrest makes perfect gun rest. Very pleased! Will definitely buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Climber
customer_reviews.text: Good price light weight and comfortable! Comes with a harness that works but isn't the best ,can't beat it for the price tho!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I would spend the extra money to get the aluminum ...
customer_reviews.text: I would spend the extra money to get the aluminum climber. Only used twice and already rusting. Powder coating is chipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pack
customer_reviews.text: My first ol’ Man climber. Always owned summits. Feel secure to the tree. Mesh seat is ok. Heavy compared to summits. It does not pack up easy. I plan to find a tree on my property and leave it there so I don’t have to pack it up and lug it thru the woods. I may even try to replace the seat with a summit one. I prefer not leaning against the tree. Just my preference. My back tends to hurt shortly into a hunt if I’m not in a comfortable seat. Definitely doesn’t compare to the 3 millinium stands I have. Maybe they will make a climber on day.
customer_reviews.author: Joel J.

product_meta.title: OL'MAN TREESTANDS Multi-Vision Climbing Stand, Steel Construction with 21" Wide Net Seat, Gray, One Size (COM-04)
product_meta.description: Three treestands in one! Configure the Multi-Vision for the way you hunt. Set up this legendary climbing stand with the classic OL’MAN straight bar, or with the included reversible Gun Rest/Foot Rest to accommodate both gun and bow hunters. The Multi-Vision Series is the quietest climbing stand on the market. It remains our best-selling tree stand. Available in the OL’MAN aluminum Pro-Series for even lighter packability. The steel Multi-vision treestand has a 21-inch wide net seat and a stand weight of 29 lbs.
feature_bullets: LEGENDARY TREESTAND: The OL’MAN Multi-vision treestand is loved by gun and bow hunters everywhere.

3 TREESTANDS IN 1: Configure the Multi-Vision for the way you hunt. Set up this legendary climbing stand with the classic OL’MAN straight bar, or with the included reversible Gun Rest/Foot Rest to accommodate both gun and bow hunters.
QUIET: The Multi-Vision Series is the quietest climbing stand on the market. It remains our best-selling tree stand.
SPECIFICATIONS: Steel Construction. Standing Platform measures 18-inches x 32-inches. Weight Limit: 300-pounds. Seat Style: 21-inch wide net. Overall Weight: 29-pounds. Seat Pad Cover: Black

OL’MAN EXPERIENCE: From our lightweight design to our rugged durability, OL’MAN Treestands are the highest quality treestands on the market today. We’re focused on customer service and comfort and stand behind everything we build.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
